cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 380 miles SE of Galveston, TX
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest, then turning north-northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX/LA border (between Port Arthur, TX and Cameron, LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Freeport TX to San Luis Pass TX; Mouth of Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS; Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas/Borgne
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane: San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA | Storm Surge: San Luis Pass TX to Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast (including Galveston Bay) and southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (72% chance); 50-kt winds possible (31%); hurricane-force winds low (10%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft of inundation possible in Galveston Bay and along the Bolivar Peninsula.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with locally up to 15 inches possible, causing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning Wednesday evening; dangerous surf and rip currents.
